verses.roman:
paugaṇḍa-līlā caitanya-
kṛṣṇasyāti-suvistṛtā
vidyārambha-mukhā pāṇi-
grahaṇāntā mano-harā

synonyms: paugaṇḍa-līlā—the pastimes of the paugaṇḍa age; caitanya-kṛṣṇasya—of Lord Caitanya, who is Kṛṣṇa Himself; ati-suvistṛtā—very much expanded; vidyā-ārambha—the beginning of education; mukhā—chief business; pāṇi-grahaṇa—marriage; antā—at the end; manaḥ-harā—very beautiful.
translation: The pastimes of the Lord during His paugaṇḍa age were very extensive. His education was His chief occupation, and after that His very beautiful marriage took place.
